channel.title: Whonix 11 "Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address"
channel.description:
today, in whonix 11 stable repository, i have got similar to this [WARN] which is included in this topic:-
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1136.msg7755.html?PHPSESSID=m8kstbdleq13g659eeeag6aio8v3utfe#msg7755

item.title: Whonix 11 "Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address"
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
ok then i will not post any arm alert unless i know the solution = which mean i will never post any topic related to arm.

Read full topic

item.title: Whonix 11 "Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address"
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Indeed. There is no perfect way to know. No perfect way to handle this.

Generally, I would say, reports of messages by ‘arm’ are not worth any report. It’s not a tool to check any security status or so. Unless you can also answer the question, it’s not worth posting the question.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix 11 "Rejecting SOCKS request for anonymous connection to private address"
